body:
I am curious on your thoughts about this issue. I was excited to see the `createControlForm` API because it greatly improves type safety for shareable components of the same form. Especially with tabs, steppers for larger forms it was pretty cumbersome to pass down control to nested components.

But with next.6 the previous feature of setting `values` inside of `useForm` stopped working. What is the intended use on combining `createFormControl` and `useForm`?

I previously tried to set `defaultValues` inside of `useForm` but that did not work in combination of `createFormControl`
I think maybe related to this https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/issues/12634 @jtomaszewski
Thanks for the report, fixed the issue and published, and I'm looking forward to publich `createFormControl`, like you state it's a great UX/DX improvement.

@bluebill1049 thanks for having a look at this issue. I updated my codepen but it still does not work providing `defaultValues` to `useForm` with `next.7` https://codesandbox.io/p/devbox/lingering-flower-rj9w57?file=%2Fsrc%2FApp.tsx&workspaceId=ws_3ziw7s9h3eux7QPwHEsnAX
can you make the codesandbox public? can't access it
nvm i will check the one on the top
yes found the issue still related the other commit

> can you make the codesandbox public? can't access it

Ohh shoot sorry I overlooked to make it public. Should work now
no, i haven't published the latest, just keep using the .next5 for now.
.next5 does not support `defaultValues`, I updated the codesandbox to reflect this.

issue.title: fix(createFormControl): don't unregister fields on reset

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
After https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/pull/12635 , unfortunately in my app an issue similar to https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/issues/12634 is still existing.

After further debugging, it appeared that [this line](https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/blob/master/src/logic/createFormControl.ts#L1343) is the cause. In some scenarios, when form values are reset, fields seem to behave as if they were unregistered, even if they component haven't been dismounted.

And assuming that the child components (which call the `useController` hook) don't get rerendered after this (which can happen, if they are memoized using react's `memo` or `useMemo` functions), then the controls won't get reregistered.

Causing the existing controls to still appear in the DOM, but e.g. their `onChange` will do nothing when being called.

This PR fixes this - instead of completely clearing the internal `_fields` object, it just resets the values of currently registered (mounted) fields.

issue.title: fix(useForm): make `values` and `defaultValues` work correctly with `createFormControl` and `useMemo`

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
1. Brings back test scenarios added in https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/issues/12634 but removed in https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/commit/ef80ff677c548aa67d1b9d6186a556057f8c0477 and https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/commit/d9e7e4d8efcf1715fee580b198cdc8bc701c3f8a
2. Adds test scenario added in https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/pull/12652
3. Adds test scenario for an issue found in #12665
4. Adds fixes to `useForm` and `createFormControl` so that all above test scenarios pass
5. Fixes test debugging with VS Code
